thread.title: Visits by Royal appointment: Buckingham Palace, Clarence House, Frogmore House
thread.title_full: Visits by Royal appointment: Buckingham Palace, Clarence House, Frogmore House

title: Visits by Royal appointment: Buckingham Palace, Clarence House, Frogmore House
text:
Visits by Royal appointment: Buckingham Palace, Clarence House, Frogmore House Visits by Royal appointment: Buckingham Palace, Clarence House, Frogmore House Now that most of the Royal Family are safely ensconced in their country estates for the summer, their loyal subjects can get into their residences and have a good old nosey around. PUBLISHED: 10:49, Sun, Aug 2, 2015 | UPDATED: 10:58, Sun, Aug 2, 2015 PA A ROYAL REVEAL: Preparing for a banquet at Buckingham Palace 
The royal residences are now open for a limited period to the public and offer a glimpse into their private lives. Buckingham Palace 
This working palace is constantly busy due to ceremonial occasions and official entertaining. 
If you’ve ever wondered how long it takes to set a table for a banquet – the Queen oversees everything from the menu to the linen, glassware and porcelain – you can find out in this year’s special exhibition, A Royal Welcome. 
There’s also the chance to explore the palace’s magnificent works of art by renowned painters, including Van Dyck and Canaletto, and its antique French and English furniture. 
The Royal Mews are a must-see – home to glittering coaches that have been used by the royals for centuries including the gold State coach and Diamond Jubilee State coach. 
State Rooms: Adults £20.50, £11.80 per child. Open until September 25, 2015 
Royal Day Out: Adults £35.60, £20.00 per child. THE ROYAL COLLECTION SNEAK PEAK: Library at Clarence House Clarence House 
The pretty “large” town house is the residence of The Prince of Wales and The Duchess of Cornwall. 
Overlooking the Mall near to Buckingham Palace this property is both homely and grand at the same time. 
Wander the garden planted by the Prince as a tribute to his grandmother while inside, tour five ground-floor rooms packed with fabulous art and furniture which showcases the exquisite taste of the late Queen Mother. 
Clarence House: Adults £9.80, £5.80 per child. Under 5s free. Open until August 31. Frogmore House 
The gorgeous Frogmore residence in the grounds of the private Home Park of Windsor Castle, was purchased for George III’s wife, Queen Charlotte. 
The drawing room, with its striking striped upholstery and floral wallpaper is like a grand country home, until you get to the King’s bedchamber, where an elaborate four-poster dominates. 
In the grounds, you can see the mausoleum of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. 
Frogmore House: Adults £9.00, £7.00 per child. Under 5s free. Open August 25-27. 
Information: The Royal Collection Trust (020 7766 7300/ royalcollection.org.uk ) Related articles
